prompt: Explain how continuous integration improves software quality.

criteria.name: Understanding of Continuous Integration (CI)
criteria.description: Demonstrates knowledge of CI concepts and tools.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Clearly explains what CI is, how it works, and names tools like Jenkins, GitHub Actions, or Travis CI.
performance_descriptors.good: Accurately describes CI and mentions at least one tool.
performance_descriptors.average: Mentions CI but gives limited detail.
performance_descriptors.needs_improvement: Basic or unclear understanding of CI.

criteria.name: Software Quality Improvement
criteria.description: Explains how CI enhances quality in software projects.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Insightfully links CI to early bug detection, automated testing, and stable releases.
performance_descriptors.good: Describes main quality benefits like fewer bugs and reliable builds.
performance_descriptors.average: States CI is good for quality without detail.

criteria.name: Use of Real-World Examples
criteria.description: Uses relevant examples to illustrate CI and its benefits.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Multiple, relevant examples with clear explanations.
performance_descriptors.good: At least one clear example provided.

criteria.name: Structure and Academic Style
criteria.description: Presents answer in a logical, academic style.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Highly organized, formal, and clear response.
performance_descriptors.good: Clear structure and mostly formal style.

key_points: Explains what CI is and how it works
Names multiple CI tools (Jenkins, GitHub Actions, Travis CI)
Links CI to early bug detection, automated testing, and stable releases
Real-world examples: Google, Microsoft, open-source projects
llm_questions: How does CI work in software development?
Which tools are used for CI?
How does CI improve software quality?
Can you give real-world examples of CI in use?
